intro: Eriocaulon flagellare, commonly known as the flagellate flat sedge, is a small aquatic or semi-aquatic plant found in wetlands and marshy areas. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. Its roots are often submerged, helping to stabilize soil and improve water quality. Eriocaulon flagellare plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and invertebrates.
